alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 23 at 11:14AM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Elko NV has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River At Comus affecting Elko County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. For the Lower Humboldt...including Comus...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Humboldt River At Comus. * WHEN...From Monday morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Minor Flood Stage. Minor lowland flooding throughout the reach. No flooding in Winnemucca. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM PDT Sunday the stage was 9.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.5 feet late tomorrow morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.5 feet on 06/13/1999. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning at 1045 AM PDT.
